Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath

Class FhirPathTime

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.FhirPathTime
public class FhirPathTime extends Object
Utility class for handling FHIRPath time values with partial precision.

This class can parse FHIRPath time strings, determine their precision, and compute lower and upper boundary Instants based on that precision. The time is always based on the Java epoch date (1970-01-01).

  • Method Details

    • parse

      @Nonnull public static FhirPathTime parse(@Nonnull String timeString)
      Parse a FHIR time string into a FhirpathTime object.
      Parameters:
      timeString - the FHIR time string to parse (e.g., 12:00)
      Returns:
      a new FhirpathTime object
      Throws:
      DateTimeParseException - if the string cannot be parsed

    • getLowerBoundary

      @Nonnull public Instant getLowerBoundary()
      Gets the lower boundary for this time value based on its precision.
      Returns:
      the lower boundary as an Instant

    • getUpperBoundary

      @Nonnull public Instant getUpperBoundary()
      Gets the upper boundary for this time value based on its precision.

      For example:

      • 12 (HOUR precision) -> 12:59:59.999999999
      • 12:30 (MINUTE precision) -> 12:30:59.999999999
      • 12:30:45 (SECOND precision) -> 12:30:45.000000000
      • 12:30:45.123 (FRACS precision) -> 12:30:45.123
      Returns:
      the upper boundary as an Instant

    • fromLocalTime

      @Nonnull public static FhirPathTime fromLocalTime(@Nonnull LocalTime localTime, @Nonnull TemporalPrecision precision)
      Utility method to create a FhirpathTime from a LocalTime and precision.
      Parameters:
      localTime - the LocalTime to convert
      precision - the desired precision (must be time-based)
      Returns:
      a new FhirpathTime

    • isTimeValue

      public static boolean isTimeValue(@Nonnull String timeValue)
      Checks if given string represents a valid Fhirpath time value.
      Parameters:
      timeValue - the time value
      Returns:
      true is the value is a valid time.
